page.title: 04Religion
page.content: In{1866 Crowthorne}was in need of a Church so the{Sandhurst Parish {Church}which is{700 years old}sent their Curate, the{Rev.H.S.N.Lenny}to Crowthorne to give "Cottage Lectures". These were held in{"Ifould's Kitchen" which was one of the first shops to be built in the village in Church Street. It is now a Newsagents. In 1868 a temporary wooden hut was erected on the site where the present Fire Station stands.{The Church of St. John {The Baptist}was built in{1873}and the first Vicar was the{Rev.H.Lenny. The {Crowthorne C of E School}is closely connected with the church and built in 1875 for the children of the village. {The Roman Catholic Church of the {Sacred Heart}was built in 1962 to replace a tin hut, which was originally erected in 1909.
